development_summary.overview: This project has successfully developed an AWS Architecture Generator Agent that can understand IT technology stacks, interpret natural language descriptions of infrastructure requirements, and generate visual AWS architecture diagrams that are technically sound and visually appealing.

key_outcomes: Identified six core functional requirements including AWS service mapping, natural language parsing, architecture diagram generation, architecture validation, visual optimization, and pattern recognition
Defined non-functional requirements for performance, security, usability, and reliability
Established project constraints, assumptions, and success criteria
Designed a single-agent architecture with modular components
Created data models for architecture requirements, AWS services, architecture design, and diagrams
Defined five interaction flows: requirement parsing, AWS service mapping, architecture design, diagram generation, and result presentation
Established security considerations, error handling strategies, and performance targets
Designed a comprehensive agent with clear role, purpose, and personality traits
Defined core capabilities including requirement parsing, service mapping, architecture design, and diagram generation
Established knowledge domains, interaction patterns, and evaluation criteria
Selected Claude 3 Opus as the recommended model for its technical understanding capabilities
Developed AWS Service Knowledge Base tool with functions for service information, search, mapping, pattern recognition, and compatibility checking
Created Architecture Diagram Generator tool with functions for diagram generation, architecture description, text extraction, and icon retrieval
Built Architecture Validator tool with functions for architecture validation, service configuration checks, compatibility verification, and best practice assessment
Designed a comprehensive prompt template that guides the LLM to function as an AWS architecture expert
Incorporated system context, persona definition, and workflow guidance
Included knowledge about AWS services, architecture patterns, and best practices
Structured the interaction flow to systematically process user requirements and generate diagrams
Implemented the AWS Architecture Generator Agent with integration of all developed tools
Created a modular code structure following the designed workflow
Added command-line interface with options for input requirements, diagram format, and detail level
Implemented error handling and logging mechanisms
Verified all components are properly integrated
Confirmed syntax validity of all scripts, tools, and prompt files
Validated tool dependencies and agent parameters
Ensured all 15 required tools are properly implemented and accessible

usage_instructions.basic_usage: Run the agent with default parameters: `python aws_architecture_generator.py`
usage_instructions.custom_requirements: Specify custom architecture requirements: `python aws_architecture_generator.py -i "Please generate an AWS architecture for a microservices e-commerce platform with high availability and disaster recovery"`
usage_instructions.output_format: Select diagram output format: `python aws_architecture_generator.py -f drawio` (supported formats: mermaid, drawio)
usage_instructions.detailed_output: Generate detailed architecture with explanations: `python aws_architecture_generator.py -d`

maintenance_recommendations: Regularly update the AWS service knowledge base to include new services and features
Enhance the diagram generator to support additional output formats as needed
Consider adding cost estimation capabilities in future versions
Monitor user feedback to identify common architecture patterns for pre-optimization
